Context:
The text is about a business program offered by the School of Management at the college. Upon completing this program, also known as B416 or startGBC, students will have created a full business plan, financial plan, identified sources of funding, and prepared a website. To graduate from this program, 10 mandatory courses need to be completed:

Semester 1:
- HRM 4002: Human Resources
- LAW 4003: Legal Aspects of Entrepreneurship
- MGMT 4042: Finance and Accounting for Entrepreneurs
- MGMT 4043: Entrepreneurial Integrated Supply Chain Management
- MARK 1042: Principles of Marketing
- MGMT 4044: Business Research

Semester 2:
- MGMT 4045: Business Channel Strategies
- MGMT 1036: Business Plan Creation
- MGMT 4046: Entrepreneurial Speaker Series
- Sales and marketing course (MARK 1028)

The graduate of this program will be able to develop, present, and analyze a comprehensive business plan; assess and use current concepts/systems and technologies; develop strategies for implementing effective marketing plans; use accounting and financial principles to support the management and operations of an enterprise; select sales and customer service strategies; apply human resource practices; implement principles of supply chain management and operations management. The text also mentions a transfer guide for future study options and a printable curriculum planner for 2023-2024.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Entrepreneurship Management Program (Postgraduate) B416 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information about a small business operations program offered by George Brown College. Here are the key facts extracted from the text:

1. The program focuses on conducting small business activities in compliance with legislation, policies, health and safety regulations, professional standards, tax requirements, and other fiscal needs.
2. It promotes sustainability and corporate social responsibility principles for small businesses.
3. Students are expected to prepare a plan for ongoing personal and professional development, network, and seek business opportunities.
4. Project management skills are taught to plan, implement, and evaluate projects for small businesses.
5. Market research is used to optimize the operation of small businesses.
6. Risk management strategies are implemented to support various aspects of small business operations.
7. The tuition costs for domestic students are $4,292 for the first two semesters starting in Fall 2022 and subject to change for future semesters.
8. International students pay $17,774 for the first two semesters starting in Fall 2023, with fees being subject to change for later semesters.
9. OSAP funding is available for this program, but applicants must meet eligibility criteria.
10. Admission requirements include a college advanced diploma, bachelor's degree, or relevant work experience.
11. English language proficiency tests may be required for international students and those applying based on work experience.
12. Students can apply for course exemptions with approved college and university credits.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Entrepreneurship Management Program (Postgraduate) B416 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: For Domestic students, they should apply through Ontario Colleges. For international students, they should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. There are information sessions held on a regular basis for domestic students to have questions answered and learn about program content and career options. Domestic students can contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section for inquiries about admission requirements, deadlines, and the admissions process. International students can contact international recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin either by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page. For financial inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section. To receive advice on program options and which program might be best suited for a student, make an appointment to see an Entry Advisor. The Centre for Business can be contacted at business@georgebrown.ca or (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160. For inquiries related to the Entrepreneurship Management (B416) program, contact Tom Supra, Program Co-ordinator, at tsupra@georgebrown.ca. The Centre for Business can also be followed on Instagram and LinkedIn.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Entrepreneurship Management Program (Postgraduate) B416 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The text mentions that the program is offered out of the School of Management at George Brown College. The classes usually take place at the St. James Campus, specifically at 200 King St. E. and 290 Adelaide St. E., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. International students can contact recruitment representatives through the International Contact Us page or by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry.
